H0.text: when was the first underwater cable laid beneath the english channel. 1830

H1.text: when was the first underwater cable laid beneath the english channel. 1842

H2.text: when was the first underwater cable laid beneath the english channel. 1845

H3.text: when was the first underwater cable laid beneath the english channel. 1850

A4.text: In August 1850, John Watkins Brett's English Channel Submarine Telegraph Company laid the first line across the English Channel using the converted tugboat Goliath.

A5.text: In September 1851 a protected core, or true, cable was laid by the reconstituted Submarine Telegraph Company from a government hulk, Blazer, which was towed across the Channel.

A6.text: In 1845, the latter suggested that it should be employed to cover the wire which was proposed to be laid from Dover to Calais.
